meanings.definition: Partially upright or raised in position
meanings.sent1: The tree in the wind was semierect, leaning slightly to one side.
meanings.sent2: The flagpole stood semierect, not completely straight but not fully bent either.
meanings.sent3: The semierect umbrella kept tipping over in the breeze, causing laughter among the picnic-goers.
meanings.sent4: His confidence was semierect, wavering between boldness and hesitation.
meanings.sent5: The semierect mountain peak cast a long shadow in the evening sun.
